WRITING.TEXT: Hi all! I run a Youtube Channel [here](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdBVtFcCUvxHWvgoUmTLByg). It's a mixed channel, so I have Let's Plays (just started a SOMA one) bu I also have Disney related videos and topical vlogs. It kind of encompasses everything I love. But I put up at least 1 gaming video a week, if not more, so definitely check it out if that's up your alley.
I will be with a few friends. Always willing to meet and say hi!

It's my gamertag. Not a super exciting story ha, but it made sense because i use the gamertag for everything, for all my social login names etc (like this one!). It just made sense to extend that to my Youtube channel and then people can easily find me on Steam, PS4, reddit, Twitch, etc.

also have the same problem. I get about 2 mornings a week where im ok. Otherwise, painful stomach aches that make me sweat and not able to stand straight. "feels like im in labor" is exactly how ive described it before too (not that id know, but its the best way to describe the pain intensity). It'll come in waves too, like ill go, 15 min later more pain, go again, 30 min later, more pain, go again...then im finally OK rest of the day. doesn't matter what i eat. ive tried every diet change imaginable.
I would've prob shed a tear while nodding. I love that man to the moon back, so much a part of my childhood! so awesome!
that's odd, was it just a bug? I couldnt even find any servers to join and when I started my own there was just nobody to play with.

my last trip was solo and i only went because of a ridiculous airfare deal i got. it was only 3 days and it ended up costing me about $600 for the trip with an extra $250 for food and souvenirs. It was just slightly less than "satisfying", a 4th day would have been needed. So, i dont know.... $1200?
I wish there were more people on this game. I feel like it was so hard for me to do anything on a server, it was just me rolling solo.

Donald is my favorite, hands down. I had the BEST interaction with him in Mexico in Epcot when i asked him what it would be like if it were all started with a duck. He was hilaaarious! Waving his arms around like he was envisioning the park, giving me kisses for saying he's #1. Loved it.
not much, if any. Art of Disney stuff definitely has a couple of things but dont count on finding a lot. I feel your pain; hunchback is my favorite and i rarely find a thing in the parks around it.

mind if i ask how long it took to arrive? I'm waiting on mine. Approved last tuesday, opted for expedited card but still not here yet. Trying to get it before thursday as I'm going away for the weekend and want to put my hotel charge on it!

First of all, hi from NY! I hope you have a wonderful time here. second, i feel you. last week i was flying home from SXSW and for some reason i decided to wake up an hour earlier than i needed to, and thank god i did. i had the WORST stomach problems, the kind that were painful and burned. It took 3 imodiums to clear it up and then i didnt go to the bathroom at all for 2 days after :-/
I live in Manhattan myself, would love to meet up sometime!

Garrus from Mass Effect. I'd have his Taurian babies.
Also, Alistair from Dragon Age. Melted. My. Heart.

My backlog on steam is terrifying. i have 122 games, id say ive probably completed...30 of them, if that. I usually have a game going on PS4 and a game on Steam im playing through taking turns. I also have a youtube channel though and trying to keep up with content for that but also have games i just play on my own without having to record and entertain anybody puts me in crazy backlog limbo haha
I second this. Coronado Springs is hella beautiful! A resort I enjoyed just being in outside of the parks.
There's one called Punderdome in NYC and the people who compete are actually REALLY funny. But you can tell they've done it before. It's nothing like this horridness.
Aww, thanks! Yup been a Redditor for some time ;)
I don't have the luxury of distance but I'm in nyc and there's often great spur of the moment flight deals. So still worth it! If i can get at least 2 good trips in annually I'll be good!

it convinced me to get an annual pass next year. I was already planning an 8 day trip (5 or 6 days WDW) for next feb. i was hesitant on an annual pass because i figured no friends would go again later in the year, but now that im so comfortable going solo ill prob just do that!
As requested, im posting the video I made after my solo WDW experience. I hope this helps the lot of you who are considering it and sparks some discussion!

WRITING.TITLE: My Top Tips for Traveling to WDW Solo

WRITING.TEXT: I don't smoke and don't have an interest to, but meditation sounds like something i should more seriously consider.

WRITING.TITLE: Therapy To Ease Anxiety Obsessive Thoughts Over IBS?
WRITING.TEXT: Has anyone gone to therapy as part of their treatment for IBS? I've done the full dr thing, and most meds havent helped me aside from a regular dosage of imodium when feeling ill. But the mental aspect of IBS is really affecting me. Every single day I wake up, i fear feeling ill. On my way to work I'm constantly worried about having an accident (i take public transportation, live in NYC), i am always thinking about nearest bathrooms. If my day is full of back to back meetings, i get worried. If I'm traveling, I get worried. I wonder if anyone has gone to therapy to try and curb the constant stress and anxiety and overthinking, and if it's helped you. I have gone to therapy before, many years ago, for a past eating disorder (that yes, i think may have attributed to my IBS unfortunately) so im no stranger to the idea, but little hesitant on spending the $$. want to hear other people's opinions.
I've had the same debit card 2 credit cards for years. I can only remember the last 4 digits.
Same here :(
yeah and mine is...definitely not haha it was something i whipped together when teaching myself animation. so im wondering if i should just drop it.
magic! :) thanks.

right; I noticed I started to open my videos the same, unintentionally. "Hey guys, it's Christine also known as IvyWinter, today we're going to be playing/going to be talking about..." so now it's just become a thing I always do. So i wonder if that's enough and i can kill the animated text/music intro. I liked it at first but now I kind of don't!

WRITING.TITLE: Videos without Intros?
WRITING.TEXT:
So I have an (ok) intro that's about 6 seconds long. I've uploaded a couple of videos without it recently to see if it helps with retention at all. Do any of you just forgo intros altogether? Have any of you experimented with having them on some videos and not on others? Do you find they help, are a hindrance, or neither? Curious about experiences!
EDIT: thanks everyone for feedback. it seems that intros aren't a necessary element and so i think im going to drop mine, especially because i don't love it so much anymore anyway. Thanks!
I don't know who runs this Twitter list but I'd love to be added, my Twitter name is IvyWinterYT. I didn't even know this existed! totally subbed to it, excited to meet new people!

I got really annoyed at a guest this week who was following around the stormtroopers that patrol in HS. They had stopped to take a couple of pictures with kids, and this guy was walking up on the side of that picture, trying to take a selfie with the stormtrooper. It was incredibly rude, and it wasn't even like it was my kids! Like, people are taking photos, chill bro!

I rode Rock N Rollercoaster 4 times in a row in less than an hour thanks to single rider. Test Track i walked on in literally 5 minutes. I didnt do AK so cant say for Expedition Everest. It was so quick for Test Track i didnt need my fastpass so I changed it to a different experience!
No charge, very convenient, if a little dangerous. "oh i want that!" **beep** "I don't really need this doughnut but..." **beep**

I will definitely post a link to the solo tips video when it happens, but if you want to just sub to see the vlogs (i dont want to bombard this subreddit at all with that) you can do so [here](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdBVtFcCUvxHWvgoUmTLByg)
I'm hoping to have some up in the next couple of weeks.

There were moments were i pushed myself but i also felt like sit down meals were good mid day breaks. I also had moments where i slowed down, like i took some time to sit near the Cinderella fountain behind the castle and chill with a coffee one morning. That was lovely.

Sure! I always ask first with sharing, im active here as part of the community in general but never want to seem overly self promotional. You know how it is! [Here's my channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdBVtFcCUvxHWvgoUmTLByg)

Fantasmic was at 7pm, Symphony in the Stars was 8pm. Fantasmic ends at 7:30 or so, and i started to get up during the finale. Watched the finale from standing near the exit, then just walked out and to towards the chinese theater. Was there at 7:45 and got a prime spot.

Truth is, the first hour or so is gonna feel weird. Then you are going to get the parks and realize there's so much to do, see, and enjoy, you won't care. Everything gets easier after arrival! I did only HS, MK and Epcot, no AK because it wasn't possible with 3 days.

neither can i (or should i say now, have i, yet). That's the wild thing! I dont ever dine alone, go to movies alone... but i know disney well and so i felt like if there was a place to start enjoying my own company, this was it. I feel like i could easily see a movie alone now!

WRITING.TITLE: Just Back From My First Solo Trip...
WRITING.TEXT:
got home last night. it was AMAZING. my 12th trip, and my first alone, and quite possibly my best disney trip in YEARS. I DID ALL THE THINGS! I rode Rock n rollercoaster 4x in a row. I completed a night show trifecta of Fantasmic, Symphony in the Stars Illuminations. I met Donald, Mickey, Minnie, Goofy, Chip n Dale and Kylo Ren! I ate at the new Skipper's Canteen and shopped at Basin White in the Grand Floridian. I caught the Dapper Dans, Festival of Fantasy, Voices of Liberty, and so much more entertainment. I had a FREAKING BLAST!
I'm a youtuber and will eventually have vlogs up but also will do a video about tips for solo travel, which if no one minds I'll share whenever they happen (probably not for a bit, just trying to come down from the Disney high and get back to real life!). But it was wonderful. If you have any questions about traveling solo, please feel free to ask! and thanks to everyone here who encouraged me to do it :)

To this point, a lot of people told me not to add vlogs or anything else on a let's play channel and at first I was afraid to do so. People said to start a new channel instead. But I realized that I was too small to do that and wasn't going to be able to build an audience on both. So I decided to start putting up vlogs and other content on my gaming channel. It's done really well for me. People just come for the content they like and skip on the videos they don't like but either way it's worked out
Thanks for the update I'll look it over! didn't realize there was a change :)

WRITING.TITLE: Attempting a Skincare Routine, With Lush Products

WRITING.TEXT: Yes, and i didn't love it. Then i went to the real Morocco... and now I really don't love it. It's not anything like the authentic cuisine!

lucky you! my boyfriend super disliked disney. Doesn't win over all, that's for sure! But, he doesnt like amusement parks in general so the heat, lines and people just got to him.Thankfully, it doesn't stop me from going (like my solo trip in 5 days... he just said "go have fun!" because he at least gets my love won't change!).

WRITING.TITLE: So Much Gas Every Morning Leading to BMs
WRITING.TEXT: It's kind of ridiculous. Every morning I wake up, and pass gas for about 20- 30 minutes. I feel it moving around in my stomach, uncomfortably so, and i passes loud and obnoxious (not always smelly, sometimes just forceful). Then i get to the last couple where it's like, ok no I need to go to the bathroom now. EVERY. MORNING. no matter what ive eaten the day before. I have days where i eat very little due to not feeling well and even after those days im gassy as heck. Is it a food thing, or is it a body doesn't know what to do with gas at night thing? I'm wondering if my body is passing any in my sleep, or if it's all just sitting in there until i wake up. and it's all usually a precursor to 2-3 BMs which i try to have before i have to leave for work, but obviously sometimes im late :-/ sometimes the BMs are manageable, sometimes painful and liquid like. but all times it starts with gas. so. much. gas.

80 days. I LOVE the game but it's so text heavy because it's essentially a choose your own adventure with a facade of traveling the globe. I just don't think there's a way to let's play it that would be interesting, even if all the text was read out loud.

WRITING.TEXT: Seriously, GIANT BABIES?! Watch me get freaked out on my newest Let's Play video! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sD81pnWkzKA

Thank you! I've heard mixed thoughts on the food. I guess we'll see! I'm not crazy finicky, so im sure ill find something i like :)
The atmosphere

I love both very much but Coronado has my heart. It's big, beautiful, has hammocks to relax on, amazing to take a stroll around the lake at night.

Although I say above I'm going to Animal Kingdom the morning of my second day, I'm considering skipping AK altogether and doing rope drop at Magic Kingdom because I do like MK more than AK. the only thing that is making me not do so is Everest, Dinosaur Festival of the Lion King. BUT i was just at the park in september...and i think FOMO is causing me to have crazier plans!
Also, should I cancel my Be Our Guest lunch ressie for the first day and just try the Skipper's Canteen? I've already eaten at BOG before...

WRITING.TITLE: Would Love Thoughts on My Itinerary (More in Comments)

WRITING.TEXT: An interesting European one, like Croatia or Hungary. Or, maybe something very different, non-european. maybe Cambodia. Would LOVE a temple there!

ive stayed there and yes, it IS big. The internal bus system is pretty good though, i dont remember waiting more than 5 minutes for one. And the plus of it being so big is everything feels so nicely secluded. i also loved to just take the long 10 minute walk to the pool. saw deer, bunnies. was lovely.

Yup! I leave in 10 days, i also always get a little anxiety. I check weather like a crazy person! but at some point you have to relax and just remember, a bad day at disney world is still better than a good day at work! (or so i think haha).
I'm SO excited about this. GIVE ME ALL THE STAR WARS!

Believe bus sharing only happens during most crowded times of day/seasons. Also if you stay in sports, it's the first to be picked up and dropped off if there's sharing going on, something to consider.

It makes me really analyze their marketing in a lot of different ways, but appreciate it more. I always say to my boyfriend "you may not like Disney World, but you have to admit the way they market themselves is on point!" he can never argue it!

So they'll do caricatures of pictures? I guess I never thought to do that, but one of my cat would be awesome!
Sounds like you had a great trip. Im sorry to hear you think of epcot as a half day park! for me, its 1.5-2 days. but it's also my personal favorite :)
I use the Magical Express every trip! So i don't think that had anything to do with it.

AH I see! Last time I stayed a CM friend gave me a discount on my room, so i booked just a room, then tickets later. And now come to think of it, i think everyone i was with purchased those separately, for one reason or another. Thanks!

When I went in September 2015, we didnt not receive any luggage tags. Not for myself or my boyfriend in our one package, nor did my other two friends who booked separately in theirs, or my brother and his girlfriend in theirs.

I'll be there 2/29 to 3/2. Coming from NYC, it's going to be cold here, so im going to layer an in between jacket to get me through going from here to the airport, but to also provide layers for me there. I am packing both jeans and shorts. I think it's probably best to have both on hand...you might have warm comfy days and chilly nights. And pack a hoodie. I think just having a couple of options to change into, from hot to cool weather is prob best, even if it means taking up a bit more space in your luggage.

I've honestly had poor experiences with them in terms of delays and last minute cancellations. they really screwed up a trip of mine from NY to New Orleans a couple years ago. unless they have a great deal, I just don't fly them anymore. But, everyone has different experiences.

WRITING.TITLE: Got my Magic Band... And a Free Luggage Tag! Wasn't expecting that!

WRITING.TEXT:
I'm a former cast member, but not from the parks. I worked at the World of Disney on 5th Ave in NYC for 2 years, up until it closed. I worked there part time while going to college at Hunter (on the UES).
PROS: Definitely the discounts. We were still considered the same as park CMs, WOD (as we liked to call it) was just a New York extension of the parks, and so we got all the perks of free entry, hotel discounts, comp tickets, etc. I went two times in one year, for my first time ever, due to the discounts.
The people I worked with (mostly). I made some really wonderful friends who, now 7 years after closing, I am still close with.
Being a part of a company I loved. Although the job is just retail, mostly (though there was characters entertainment on the third floor), I still really loved being a part of Disney, having my CM badge, which I still have, and representing a place I grew up adoring.
Quiet days in the store meant goofing off and playing with the toys. Our managers were fine with it as long as guests who came in weren't neglected, and guests were pretty amused by us having pirate gun fights across the second floor.
Celebrities galore! Got to meet and see quite a few in that time (Matt Damon, Britney Spears, Melissa Joan Hart, David Beckham to name a few).
CONS: every christmas season, almost every day, guests would break the glass ornaments. Often it was by accident, sometimes it was parents not watching their kids, but you'd hear that ornament fall and we'd all go "OPAH!" It sucked if you were working that section though. Anxiety the whole day, and once something broke it was like "OMG KEEP GUESTS AWAY FROM THE GLASS UNTIL SOMEONE GETS YOU A BROOM!" hated it. Apply this also year-round to snow globes, but they were less often broken.
The other few co-workers. Some were just...not nice people, there for a job and not caring about being kind or friendly. I guess not being in the parks makes a difference and I get it, tourists on 5th avenue, rough as hell to deal with sometimes. But man...these people made me so angry. Why are you working at disney then?! just go work at another retail store where your grumpiness is welcome haha.
Did i mention tourists? Some were very grateful and kind, and some were just so...so rude. Most of the rude people were foreigners, not domestic tourists.
Rich people of 5th avenue. You know, the ones that come in to buy like $2,000 worth of toys for their kids but complain about everything. Look, lady, I'm a born raised New Yorker, and I ain't taking your crap! I use to be overly nice to them and it would irk them that they weren't getting under my skin.
Closing the store. It was such a sad, sad last day. Entertainment was gone first, about 6 months earlier, and we had to explain to upset kids and sad parents that Cinderella went back to Orlando. We'd hear these stories of people not being able to afford trips to WDW so they would bring their kids to this store, and it was heart breaking to tell them the news, i never wanted to. Then the last day was sad, we shed a few tears, breaking down the whole store, our regular guests coming in and saying goodbye. Was really sad :(

In truth, last trip i just took an Uber from French Quarter to Ft Wilderness, then the internal bus (which arrived and took us up to the restaurant area in 5 min). The uber only cost us $4...which we were incredulous about since we live in NYC and ubers are easily twice the cost for the same distance!
I'm personally super excited. i'll be down in about 3 weeks, pumped to meet Kylo!

I've stayed at Pop Century, All Stars Movies and All Stars Music, Coronado Springs, Port Orleans French Quarter, Ft Wilderness cabins. Staying at All Star Sports coming up. For budget, I'd recommend Pop. For moderate, French Quarter (and similarly, Riverside) are lovely. I can't speak to Deluxe as i haven't stayed at one, but will say the Polynesian has my heart 3

I've been able to successfully use a carry on for about 6 days. More than that starts to get a little tough unless you are doing laundry at the hotel. But i definitely try as much as possible because i HATE checking in luggage. You can buy plastic bottles, empty ones, that are 3 oz or less in the travel section of a lot of convenience/drug stores. Fill er up with your sunscreen or anything else. Trust me, it'll last you. If you need to, fill two 3 oz bottles!
Speak of the devil, it shipped this morning ;) Thanks for the response!
Have a BLAST! i also booked a last minute trip (not as last minute as you, it's about 3.5 weeks away!) and the excitement in that short time frame is unbelievable! have the BEST time!

Not to hijack, but whats the shipping like when you book less than 30 days out? I'm 25 days out, was able to still customize a day ago. Just wondering what people's experiences were that booked within a month. Thanks!

I've only ever gone to Disney as an adult with friends or boyfriends in the past 10 years. I've never been treated weirdly or looked at weirdly in the parks. I see a LOT of adult groups. I've never felt a need to defend my fandom, in the parks or outside. People who do give me weird looks about in it my day to day life, i just give them the "thats just me, thats what makes me happy" shrug and end the conversation. No point in trying to convince them!
What days will you be there? That sound really cool, maybe we could meet up :) Send me a message!

That is a big thing in the back of my head, especially as a New Yorker who has trouble slowing down every day ;) but, I want to take time to watch performers and meet characters, something no one else ever wants to take time for but i love, so hopefully that naturally slows me down!

This sounds awesome! Sci-fi is actually booked, even for 1! but i really want to eat there so im trying to look often if something opens up.
I have a PS Vita, so i expect that will also keep me entertained in line :)

WRITING.TITLE: First Solo Trip In 27 Days! Tips?
WRITING.TEXT: So Jetblue had an insane sale today, $29 flights on 2/29 so I booked a quick, 3 day solo trip from NYC to Orlando. Staying All Star Sports because it was the cheapest option. 3 day park ticket. Any tips for how to do things solo? Little nervous, not only my first solo Disney trip but first solo vacation ever. Restaurant recommendations that aren't QS but aren't awkward? How do you keep busy waiting on line? Any other tips?

make the change in style only if you want to, not just for him. Otherwise you'll start dressing differently but will be miserable for it if it's not comfortable to you or doesn't feel like "you." compromising in relationships is fine, but fashion seems like such a weird thing for him to be hung up on. as long as you are doing this for you first and foremost, i support it. But don't be bullied into it just because you are in a long relationship and are afraid of it ending. just my two cents.

Oh man, ive also thought of this too. For 2 years i struggled with anorexia, and ever since i had small stomach issue that eventually turned into IBS. I also abused laxatives but i have IBS-D, not C. Ive been recovered for almost 10 years, but i honestly saw my stomach issue grow every since refeeding and gaining back the weight. This is all anecdotal obviously but you aren't alone in wondering if there could be a connection.

So regular let's plays, say 45 minutes, takes me about an hour to cut down (sometimes they end up 2 parts). Vlog style videos, not much longer than 30 minutes. I did just do a more in depth video that was myself and a friend, both on our respective webcams, each with our own audio, and then layering BG music and BG video and that took me FOREVER. probably a total of 3+ hours to cut a final 17 minutes.

I only got tested for about....30 or so things. They can test for much, much more and that often takes a couple of visits (i vaguely remember it taking 2-3 visits as a kid to get tested for EVERYTHING). I do not have a list specifically, but i know they are grouped... animals/pet dander, pollen, mold, meats, grains, oats, fruits, etc.
I got it done at an allergist's office. Don't think just any clinic will do it, has to be an allergy specialist. Just made an appointment like any other specialty dr appointment!

skin test. Lots of needles pricking you (doesnt hurt). They do rows of them for various things. If you react with a hive, you're allergic. Now i need to get a blood test to confirm because skin tests can cause false positives.
I have reactions to fresh apples as well, was also told its a cross reaction with pollen!

I know it can certainly give false positives, which is why im going for blood work to be sure. But i also know i get oral allergy reactions (itchy mouth) from oatmeal, which showed up negative on my skin test, so they are also running that through my blood test. I assume that means its possible for a false negative.

I think people just asked and took my word when i said i had no food allergies... and i didnt...15 years ago. I wasn't even thinking about how things can change, you know? wish i had thought of going sooner!

WRITING.TITLE: IBS-D for 3 Years...Got Allergy Test Today... Mind Blown.
WRITING.TEXT:
After all the celiac blood work, lactose, crohn's, colonoscopy work etc. somehow, no one though to really give me a full food allergy work up. Mostly because I had been tested as a kid, and never had any food allergies. Well, this is 15+ years later. I went into an allergist today, actually about some oral allergy issues, but she tested meat and i had a crazy bad reaction to beef, pork, and lamb. Guess what? All huge contributors to my IBS-D. It was like, eye opening. She wasn't even going to test for it originally because my oral allergies are coming from grains and oats, but she decided to do it anyway.
Now I am going for blood work to make sure none of the skin tests were a false positive, but this may be the key to me feeling better! Granted i do react from time to time to other foods but these are the biggest culprits...and it could just be an allergy!
Point is, get tested for foods, especially if it's been years. You might think you don't have an allergy...then find out you do.

Mine got lost in the mail, i contacted them and they resent me a new package, with my choice of product for anything that was sold out. It ended up being worth more than my original purchase (replacing Celebrate with a full size lotion since they don't have any others in that small size, etc). Customer service is great so don't hesitate to contact them.
